bug.short_desc: ListItems showing wrong icons after scrolling virtual list

long_desc.thetext:
The URL listed is a playground example demonstrating the problem. It simply displays a list of icon names next to their corresponding icons. Clearly, the icon images should always match the labels in the ListItems.
I am seeing the following buggy behavior in Chrome 13.0.782.220 on Mac and Windows. If you scroll up and down in the list, after a little while, you should start to see the wrong icons. For example, the folder.png icon may appear next to a user-trash.png label.
On the qooxdoo-devel list, Christian Hagendorn <christian.hagendorn@1und1.de> wrote the following:
I can remember that we have seen the issue with a devel version from Chrome in the past. At that time this was a browser bug, because the image was not applied to the DOM element even though it was set.
I can remember that too and just gave it a try in chrome 15 and it did work for me quite fine. What version of chrome did you try?

I debugged the application and it is a browser bug. Chrome doesn't set sometimes the correct background image even though it was set. I tried to find a workaround for this issue, but did not found it.
I tested the issue with 15.0.874.24 (beta) and couldn't reproduce it with the new version. It seems to me that the issue is fixed with the next Chrome release. Therefore I close the bug as WONTFIX, when the issue occurs with the new Chrome release, then please reopen this bug. Thanks.
Closed all bugs already shipped with a release.
